name: Vietnam
description: Vietnam, officially the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, is a Southeast Asian nation with a long and complex history. Bordering China to the north and Laos and Cambodia to the west, it boasts a diverse landscape ranging from the fertile Mekong Delta to the rugged mountains of the north.  Vietnam’s coastline stretches over 3,444 kilometers (2,141 miles), offering stunning beaches and vibrant marine life.  The country is known for its rich culture, delicious cuisine, and resilient people.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Vietnam has a large and growing population, contributing to its dynamic economy and vibrant culture.
quickFacts.detail: The population density is high, particularly in the Red River Delta and Mekong Delta regions.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Vietnam's diverse geography includes mountains, plateaus, deltas, and coastline.
quickFacts.detail: It's the 15th largest country in the world by area.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Hanoi, the capital, is a bustling city with a rich history and vibrant cultural scene.
quickFacts.detail: It's located in the north of Vietnam and serves as the political, economic, and cultural center.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The Vietnamese Dong is the official currency of Vietnam.
quickFacts.detail: Exchange rates fluctuate, but generally, 1 USD is approximately 24,000 VND.

quickFacts.label: Languages
quickFacts.value: Vietnamese, English (widely spoken in tourist areas)
quickFacts.description: The official language is Vietnamese, with English increasingly common.
quickFacts.detail: Regional dialects exist throughout the country.

climateData.title: Vietnam's Climate
climateData.description: Vietnam experiences a tropical monsoon climate, characterized by distinct wet and dry seasons. Temperatures vary significantly across the country, with the north being cooler and the south being warmer.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - April)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings pleasant temperatures and blooming flowers, making it a popular time to visit.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (May - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer is hot and humid, with frequent rainfall, particularly in the central and southern regions.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn offers comfortable temperatures and clear skies, making it an ideal time for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is cool and dry, especially in the north, with occasional frost and fog.

naturalWonders.name: Ha Long Bay
naturalWonders.description: Ha Long Bay is a UNESCO World Heritage site renowned for its thousands of limestone karsts and isles rising from the emerald waters. It's a breathtaking spectacle of natural beauty.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Formed over millions of years by the erosion of limestone, Ha Long Bay offers a unique and unforgettable experience.  The bay is dotted with caves, grottoes, and floating villages.
viewingTips: Take a cruise to explore the bay fully

naturalWonders.name: Phong Nha-Ke Bang National Park
naturalWonders.description: Phong Nha-Ke Bang National Park is a UNESCO World Heritage site famous for its incredible cave systems, including Son Doong, the world's largest cave.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park boasts a diverse ecosystem, including rainforests, rivers, and limestone mountains.  It's a haven for biodiversity and a popular destination for adventure travelers.

naturalWonders.name: Pu Luong Nature Reserve
naturalWonders.description: Pu Luong Nature Reserve offers stunning views of rice terraces, limestone mountains, and traditional villages, providing a glimpse into rural Vietnamese life.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The reserve is home to diverse flora and fauna, including rare primates and birds. It's a great place for trekking and experiencing authentic Vietnamese culture.

biodiversityCategory.name: Southeast Asian Rainforests
biodiversityCategory.description: Vietnam's rainforests are incredibly diverse, harboring a vast array of plant and animal species, many of which are endemic to the region.

statistics.details: Includes numerous rare and endangered species.
Home to primates, reptiles, amphibians, and a wide variety of bird species.

notableSpecies.name: Saola
notableSpecies.significance: Known as the Asian Unicorn, it's one of the rarest large mammals in the world.

notableSpecies.name: Red Shanked Douc
notableSpecies.significance: A critically endangered primate found only in Vietnam and Laos.

ecosystemData.title: Vietnam's Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Vietnam’s ecosystems are incredibly diverse, ranging from tropical rainforests to mangrove forests, rice paddies, and coral reefs. These ecosystems provide vital services, including clean water, food security, and climate regulation.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mangrove Forests
biodiversityCategories.description: Mangrove forests are vital coastal ecosystems that protect shorelines from erosion and provide habitat for numerous marine species.

statistics.details: Concentrated in the Mekong Delta and Red River Delta.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Vietnam
activities.description: Vietnam offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all levels of experience, from trekking and cycling to water sports and cultural tours.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Vietnam's stunning mountains and rice terraces on foot.

activities.name: Sapa Trekking
activities.description: Trek through the rice terraces of Sapa, experiencing the local culture and stunning scenery.
activities.requirements: Good hiking boots, layers of clothing

activities.name: Pu Luong Trekking
activities.description: Explore the lush forests and traditional villages of Pu Luong Nature Reserve.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water sports in Vietnam's beautiful coastline and rivers.

activities.name: Kayaking in Ha Long Bay
activities.description: Explore the hidden caves and karsts of Ha Long Bay by kayak.

activities.name: Snorkeling in Nha Trang
activities.description: Discover the vibrant coral reefs and marine life of Nha Trang Bay.
